com.motorola.game
Class SoundEffect

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.motorola.game.SoundEffect
public class SoundEffect
extends java.lang.Object

The SoundEffect class encapsulates the data for a game sound effect. A game may create several SoundEffect objects, one for each of the sounds that it needs to play. The sound data may be stored on the device as a named resource in the application jar file, or it can be stored on a server and retrieved via the network. SoundEffects are played by a GameScreen.

Example:

   try{
    SoundEffect s1 = createSoundEffect("/jump.wav");

    SoundEffect s2 = createSoundEffect("http://www.motorola.com/sounds/superJump.wav");

   }catch(FileFormatNotSupportedException fe){}

Method Detail

createSoundEffect

public static SoundEffect createSoundEffect(java.lang.String resource)
                                     throws FileFormatNotSupportedException
Creates a SoundEffect for the sound data stored in the specified named resource or URL. Refer to the CLDC spec for more information regarding named resources. The data must be in a sound format that is supported by the device. Though additional formats may be supported, all devices must support some format yet to be determined.
Parameters:
the - resource containing the sound data in one of the recognized formats.
Throws:
FileFormatNotSupportedException - if the specified resource is not a recognized format or the File size is too large for the internal buffers.
